newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Wah Kwong sells vessel to joint venture.
newsitem.headline: Wah Kwong sells vessel to joint venture.

text.p: Wah Kwong Shipping Holdings Ltd said on Friday it has agreed to sell its wholly owned Elegance Carriers Inc to its 50/50 joint venture with Singapore's Sembawang Maritime Ltd for US$9 million.
The only asset of Elegance is the 44,000 dwt product tanker, MV Olympic Venture, delivered last month in China's Dalian, it said in a statement.
"The intention is for the company to benefit through the joint venture for further development of its South East Asia business connections," it added.
Elegance financed the purchase of the vessel in part by a loan from Christiania Bank og Kreditkasse guaranteed by Wah Kwong, the company said.
The guarantee would be replaced by several guarantees from Sembawang Maritime and Wah Kwong, each limited to 50 percent of the outstanding amount of the loan.
The sale proceeds would be used as working capital of the company.
